That is the only Greenskin law.\n Each level of this law will be automatically passed to its next level at 100, 250, 500 and 1000 prestige for each respective level.\n The average time for the next level of the law to be enacted is 1 year, but it can be shortened with certain traits.

This is where the tribe's Greenskins live and, mostly, fight.
Greenskin fortifications are like the Greenskins themselves, crude and unsubtle, but effective.
The characteristic giant boars that the brutal Orcs use as mounts are bred here.

The cunning Goblins breed and train their fast wolf mounts here. Giant Wolves and Trolls don't mix well with each other, and as such, you can only have either a Goblin Wolf Pit or a Troll Pen in a province, but not both.
The disciplined Black Orcs make their home here. Their imposing presence is enough to make the other Greenskins fight cohesively.

The lumbering and stupid Trolls commonly join Greenskin armies, attracted and goaded on by spears and bait. Trolls and Giant Wolves don't mix well with each other, and as such, you can only have either a Troll Pen or a Goblin Wolf Pit in a province, but not both.

Here live the Night Goblins, a Goblin breed accustomed to live in the mountains and underground caves of the Old World. They make extensive use of squigs, small carnivorous creatures related to Greenskins, usually riding them into battle.

The Forest Goblins make their home in the deepest forests of the Old World, as such, they have an affinity with archery and ambushes. Spiders are an important part of their culture, and the Forest Goblins ride the large, horse-sized variant into battle.

The treacherous Goblins have their home here. Goblins are by nature craven creatures, as such, their main tactic consists of swarming their opponents with spears and arrows. They're not quality warriors though, and will flee at the slightest hint of defeat.

Arachnarok Spiders are a truly gigantic creatures, able to overpower even the formidable beasts. These creatures live in the deepest forests and jungles, where Forest Goblins worship each one of them as a living god. They are usually accompanied by broods of smaller, horse-sized spiders, the Arachnarok's "children", no less ravenous than their mothers.

The wild Savage Orcs gather here. Savage Orc camps are crude even by Greenskin standards, consisisting mostly of a disorganized lot of tents made from animal hides and bone supports, built around great fires where their Shamans gyrate and ponce while blabbering about the Greenskin Gods.

In ancient times, the lands of Tilea and Estalia were united in a great empire, under the guidance of Myrmidia incarnate herself. A long time has passed since this, and now the Estalian Kings and Tilean Princes squabble over petty conflicts. A powerful ruler who controls both lands can, perhaps, end these conflicts and become the second incarnation of Myrmidia...

Friends, [Root.Culture.GetName]s, countrymen, lend me your ears! After the miraculous recovery of territory lost centuries ago, Myrmidia's Empire has been reborn! Tilea & Estalia have endured dark times. After the era of Myrmidia Incarnate, our lands were stormed by Greenskins, bandits, pretenders and northern barbarians, and territory after territory burned at their touch, but now a bright new age has dawned for all of civilization.\n\n[Root.GetTitledFirstName] has been crowned by the Última Águila as Myrmidia Incarnate at the great cathedral of Magritta, and now rules [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] as the second Incarnation of Myrmidia!
This character has been recognized as Myrmidia Incarnate, and ruler of Her restored empire.

The keeps of the Estalian castles – and the fortresses themselves – are usually built in a mixture of native Estalian architecture with a lot of Arabyan influences. Professional foot soldiers residing in these keeps usually prefer the pike, rather than the axe, mace or sword, since those are considered weapons reserved to rogues, scoundrels and Diestros, and also, to better fit into the Tercio Square, the mainstay formation of Estalian armies.
The Estalians are famed for their Tercio formations, where ranks of pikemen form an impenetrable wall of sharp steel points, supported by crossbowmen to the sides.

Influenced by both Estalian and Arabyan light cavalry traditions, Genitores shun heavy armour and lances in favour of light armour and spears. These well trained horsemen are fast and manoeuvrable in the battlefield.

column2: Mingol Zharr-Naggrund is the true capital of all Chaos Dwarfs. It is a great ziggurat-city made out of obsidian, equal parts fortress, factory and temple. Great factories, which run thanks to the waters of the River Ruin and the toil of thousands of slaves, forge all kinds of mass-produced armours and weapons, which are often sold all around the Dark Lands and beyond.

The Tower of Gorgoth rests atop a plateau in a small volcanic mountain range in the southern region of the Dark Lands. Deep within the remains of the long extinct volcano Azgorh, the Dawi Zharr found there to be vast seams of precious minerals. Untold numbers of slaves have been brought here over the centuries, and the mines have developed into an extensive network.  A huge garrison of Chaos Dwarfs keeps vigilance over the tower and the surrounding area with rocket batteries aligned along the ramparts and towers of the citadel.

Guardian of the south-eastern teaches of the Chaos Dwarf realm, the Black Fortress is a vast, jagged citadel stained black by the Volcanic fires of the rocky plateau on which it sits. Along with the Tower of Gorgoth, it vies for prominence and power as the second most important fortress-citadel of the Chaos Dwarfs beyond their heartland on the Zharrduk Plain. Unlike the Tower of Gorgoth, the purpose of the Black Fortress is as a purely military outpost, and is headquarters for the Legion of Azgorh. The legion is a mighty standing army which watches over the desolated southern Dark Lands, escorts the far-flung slave caravans through the Howling Wastes and stands as a bulwark against frequent invasions of Ogres, Orcs and worse from the east.

The Sorcerer-Prophets are the great masters of the Chaos Dwarf race, directing the labours of their slaves and the conquests of their armies, their sorcerous powers granted by the Bullfather, Hashut. Thanks to their dark patron, they have completely embraced the arts of magic, with a dire price. Since Dwarfs were never meant to practise magic, over time a Chaos Dwarf Sorcerer will gradually turn to stone, starting from their feet, until the entire body is consumed and they becomes a statue. This trait also gives access to spells from the Lore of Hashut.

Mounted into battle by the Chaos Dwarfs, a Great Taurus is a terrible sight to behold. A gigantic winged bull, wreathed in infernal flames, it's temperament matching that of it's fell masters. Whoever dares to strike this beast will surely be engulfed by the flames that compose it's body.

Only the Sorcerer-Prophets of the Chaos Dwarfs may ride a Lammasu into battle. Similar to a Great Taurus, but with clawed forelimbs, an eerie face that resembles that of a Chaos Dwarf, and a cunning and vileness to match their masters'. Lammasu are impervious to magic, and some are even known to cast spells from the Lores of Fire and Shadow.

You also have a chance to imprison characters that are residing in that province. At the successive sieges, you will only get the chance to imprison characters.

Start the rituals to be granted the greatest gift from the Father of Darkness, mastery over the magic arts. Hashut is not a generous deity, and you'll need to offer Him a great number of sacrifices and start a great ceremony in hopes of being seen as worthy of this gift by the Bullfather...

As the temple's Bull Centaur places [From.GetHerHim] close to the furnace, you hear the mumblings of a [From.Religion.GetName] prayer to [From.Religion.GetHighGodName].\n\nThe Bull Centaur looks to you, his sturdy skin, blessed by Hashut, unaffected by the extreme heat that comes off the statue's furnace. EVTDESC_chaos_dwarf_buy_stuff;You have decided to buy armaments from the Chaos Dwarfs of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. [From.GetTitledFirstName] receives you at the gates of [From.Capital.GetName]: Welcome to Mighty [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [Root.Culture.GetName]! Which grand creation of the Dawi Zharr do you wish to purchase?
I wish to buy Chaos weapons and armours for my warriors!
I will buy nothing from you squat weaklings!

[From.GetTitledFirstName], a [From.Culture.GetName] from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has come to [Root.Capital.GetName] seeking to purchase Chaos armours and weapons from our factories to arm [Root.GetHerHis] warriors.

[From.GetTitledFirstName], a [From.Culture.GetName] from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has come to [Root.Capital.GetName] seeking to purchase a regiment of mighty Doomcanon infernal engines from our factories.
Very well! Get those armaments ready!
Very well! Get those Doomcannons ready!
No! I won't sell anything to a filthy [From.Culture.GetName]!

Now that you've decided what to purchase from [From.Capital.GetName]'s factories, you have to pay the price for it. The Chaos Dwarfs accept payments in gold or slaves. If you wish to pay in slaves, you'll need to either give them slaves from your own pits or some inhabitants of your capital province.
I will pay in slaves from my own pits!
That's incredibly expensive. Maybe next time.
The people of [Root.Capital.GetName] shall be my payment!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to pay in gold. While it isn't a payment as good as slaves would have been, it's still good enough.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to pay you in slaves from [From.GetHerHis] pits. The slaves appear to be weary, having been taken from many lands and races, but are still in good condition to work in our factories or serve in our hosts.

Amusingly enough, [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has decided to chain [From.GetHerHis] own people in [From.Capital.GetName] and send them to you as slaves! The [From.Culture.GetName] slaves appear to be in a decent condition, enough to work in our factories or serve in our hosts!
A thousand slaves for our toil!
A thousand slaves for our toil!

Finally, the detachment of Doomcannons that you brought from [From.GetTitledFirstName] has arrived at [Root.Capital.GetName]! Mighty infernal engines of terrible destructive power, the Doomcannons are accompanied by a small regiment of Chaos Dwarf Hellforge Guards, to ensure that the demons trapped inside the engines don't turn them against their masters.

The Chaos weapons and armour you brought from [From.GetTitledFirstName] have finally arrived at [Root.Capital.GetName]! Your warriors are starting to arm themselves with these powerful items... their strength will surely be incremented a thousandfold!.
New, fresh slaves have arrived at [Root.Capital.GetName]. Where shall we send them to work?
A regiment of Doomcannons arrives in [Root.Capital.GetName]
I will soar on wings of fire and smoke!
A cunning beast, the Lammasu may only be mounted by those chosen by Hashut!

Most of the Great Tauruses in the plains of Zharrduk come from the breeding pens under the temple of Hashut in Zharr-Naggrund. While most of the beasts there are fully grown, it takes time for the Chaos Dwarf Sorcerers to attune the beast's binding enchantments to a new rider. These rituals will be completed in 5 years.

Outside of the plains of Zharrduk, the Great Tauruses can only be found in their natural habitats, inside the calderas of active volcanoes. You have managed to convince one of the Bull Centaurs guarding [From.Capital.GetName]'s temple to snatch a young calf from one of the nearby volcanoes. The beast will be fully grown and magically bound in 5 years.

Finally, the Great Taurus is tamed, the magical beast's binding enchantments fully attuned so that it obeys your will completely. The Great Tauruses are considered by the Chaos Dwarfs to be the living images of Hashut, great, winged bulls surrounded by a wreathing aura of infernal flame.
On wings of fire and smoke I soar!

Only the Sorcerer-Prophets of Hashut have the magical prowess to master a Lammasu as their mount. But these beasts cannot be binded by magic alone, like the Great Tauruses. Lammasus are cunning, intelligent beasts, and must as well be bargained within order to be completely mastered, for not even the Dawi Zharr would dare mount a Lammasu without pacting with it before. The process to find, convince and master a Lammasu will take 5 years.

Finally, the Lammasu has been brought down to your service, through equal parts of deceit and magical skill. The Lammasus are beasts of insidious cunning, resembling Great Tauruses in it's bovine body, leathery wings and back quarters, but with clawed forelimbs and an eerie bearded, and horned face, resembling a Chaos Dwarf in many ways.
This is where the Chaos Dwarf warriors and Fire-Glaive units get trained and equipped with the best weapons from the Dawi Zharr forge factories.

The most favoured out of all the servants of the Chaos Dwarfs, the Hobgoblins from the eastern steppes are adept at riding the giant wolves the prowl their native lands. They will usually follow Dawi Zharr armies on their campaigns of slave raiding, and herd their slaves afterwards as overseers.

Thanks to their industrialized mining operations, Chaos Dwarfs have the resources to build huge factories in which thousands of slave labour produce standardised equipment. Through these methods, they churn out hundreds of suits of armour, weapons and infernal engines, which in turn the Chaos Dwarfs sell to those who can pay their prices, usually their neighbours in the Chaos Wastes.

The Chaos Dwarfs often use masses of Human, Dwarf, Elf and Greenskin slaves as part of their armies as well, driven forward to battle by whipping overseers, simply to expend the foe's ammunition and clog up his battle line with bodies, with death their only real objective. Mingol Zharr-Naggrund is the true capital of all Chaos Dwarfs. It is a great ziggurat-city made out of obsidian, equal parts fortress, factory and temple. Great factories, which run thanks to the waters of the River Ruin and the toil of thousands of slaves, forge all kinds of mass-produced armours and weapons, which are often sold all around the Dark Lands and beyond.

The Tower of Gorgoth rests atop a plateau in a small volcanic mountain range in the southern region of the Dark Lands. Deep within the remains of the long extinct volcano Azgorh, the Dawi Zharr found there to be vast seams of precious minerals. Untold numbers of slaves have been brought here over the centuries, and the mines have developed into an extensive network.  A huge garrison of Chaos Dwarfs keeps vigilance over the tower and the surrounding area with rocket batteries aligned along the ramparts and towers of the citadel.

Guardian of the south-eastern teaches of the Chaos Dwarf realm, the Black Fortress is a vast, jagged citadel stained black by the Volcanic fires of the rocky plateau on which it sits. Along with the Tower of Gorgoth, it vies for prominence and power as the second most important fortress-citadel of the Chaos Dwarfs beyond their heartland on the Zharrduk Plain. Unlike the Tower of Gorgoth, the purpose of the Black Fortress is as a purely military outpost, and is headquarters for the Legion of Azgorh. The legion is a mighty standing army which watches over the desolated southern Dark Lands, escorts the far-flung slave caravans through the Howling Wastes and stands as a bulwark against frequent invasions of Ogres, Orcs and worse from the east.

The center of a Dawi Zharr settlement is usually a Ziggurat-Temple of Hashut. These structures are great stepped pyramids, made out of resistant black obsidian. In Chaos Dwarf society have multiple functions, Ziggurats are their temples, laboratories, factories and fortresses. At the summit of the Ziggurat usually stands a brazen statue of the Bullfather, as well as the sacrificial pit made, filled with molten metal, as well as the personal quarters of the Ziggurat's master, be they one of the warlords known as Despots or Overlords or a Sorcerer-Prophet of Hashut.

The thick outer walls of a Chaos Dwarf Ziggurat are made out of the same dark obsidian as the rest of the structure. While common obsidian is known to be brittle, the Dawi Zharr have perfected their obsidian bricks into a strong material, thanks to their magical skill, alchemy and other darker, sorcerous secrets. As such, these towering walls strike an imposing visage amongst the enemies – and slaves – of the Chaos Dwarfs.

The Bull-Centaurs are the custodians of the ziggurat-temples of Hashut, and the most favored of His children. They are the twisted combination of a Chaos Dwarf upper torso and the lower body of a ferocious bull, transformed to a shape most pleasing to the Father of Darkness. They are a brutal shock force in battle, armed with the best equipment from the Dawi Zharr forges.

The Daemon-Smiths ( and a good deal of expendable slave labour ) are responsible for forging all the wicked armaments, artifacts and daemon engines of the Dawi Zharr. To create these powerful contraptions, they usually bind daemons to them and infuse their creations with the energies of Chaos. For the Chaos Dwarfs, magic and daemons are just another tool or resource, no different from iron and coal. Their Hellforges usually provide a few daemon engines, though nowhere as much as could be mass-produced in one of the Slave Factories.

In the lowest levels of the great Ziggurat-Temples, thousands of slaves spent their short and miserable lives toiling in the underground mines and forges of the Dawi Zharr. While most of their slave population is captured from elsewhere, the Chaos Dwarfs usually breed the lowest kinds of Greenskins, such as Goblins and Gnoblars, inside their Ziggurats' lower levels in order to ensure a minimal of slave labour to work in their underground mines. The ones no longer fit to work in their mines are often herded into battle as meatshields.

Thanks to the combination of industrial and magical prowess, the Chaos Dwarfs are able to construct massive fleets in a matter of years, which are then used to transport their slaver armies across the world in search of fresh slaves for their countless factories and endless sacrifices.
Worshippers of Chaos Undivided, Khorne, Nurgle, Tzeentch and Slaanesh can use this only against these same religions. Worshippers of Hashut may only subjugate worshippers of Hashut.

The Chaos Dwarfs are known to trade the armaments they produce on their factories with the Chaos worshippers of the Northern Wastes and the Greenskins, in exchange for gold or slaves.\n [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will get the choice to buy either weapons and armours for your warriors, or a contingent of Doomcannons from us.

This character has committed sacrilege against the Father of Darkness by forgoing to feed any sacrifices to the furnaces of Hashut for too long. An offering must be made to the Bullfather soon, or this character will face the disdain of its peers.
This character has earned the ire of Hashut by providing an unworthy sacrifice.

For too long have the furnaces at [Root.Capital.GetName] remained silent and devoid of any kind of offering. You have gone 4 years without a proper sacrifice to Hashut. The Father of Darkness does not look kindly upon those who fail to pay Him tribute...
I'm sure the Bullfather doesn't mind...
Raise the icon. Load the furnaces. The Father of Darkness will have His spoils today, that we may be blessed tomorrow...

The acolytes of Hashut have prepared the furnaces at the top of [Root.Capital.GetName]'s ziggurat for your grand sacrifice ceremony by chanting the sacred dirges. Now is the time, to offer the souls of slaves and wretches to the Bullfather, so that our Lord Hashut may feast on them.\n\nThe temple's Bull Centaurs look to you with anticipation, ready to retrieve the next sacrifice at your command...
Herd in slaves from the factories!
Bring the wretches that form our slave levies!
Our prisoners shall have the honour to become sacrifice!
I've changed my mind! Hashut doesn't deserve any gifts!

Your watch gleefully as the Bull Centaurs drag [From.GetTitledFirstName] up the stairs of the ziggurat, towards the great, brazen statue of Hashut, a pool of molten metal beneath it acts as it's furnace. As the Bull Centaur places [From.GetHerHim] close to the furnace, you hear the mumblings of a prayer to [From.Religion.GetHighGodName].\n\n[From.GetFirstName] tries to keep a stoic composure... but it soon fades into agony as [From.GetSheHe] is submerged into the molten metal...

As the last of the sacrifice's laments echo through the chamber... you feel that your body is now strong as a Bull Centaur's and your mind is quick as a Daemon's... certainly, you have been blessed by the Bullfather!

As the last of the sacrifice's laments echo through the chamber... you don't notice any changes, at first, but when you step out of the Zigurrat's ceremonal changer you notice that your whole land has been covered in a thick, red smoke which seems to be unnaturally empowering your forges and slaves, certainly [Root.Capital.GetName] has been blessed by the Bullfather!

As the last of the sacrifice's laments echo through the chamber... you don't see any changes, at first, but when you step out of the Zigurrat's ceremonal changer you notice that a small regiment of Bull Centaurs is waiting at it's feet, willing to serve you! Clearly, this is Father Hashut's providence gracing us!

As the last of the sacrifice's laments echo through the chamber... you notice a cloud of red smoke forming in front of you, in a wink, it quickly files towards you and forces itself down your throat, making you pass out... when you awake, you're informed by the temple's Acolytes that you must have somehow earned Hashut's wrath, and indeed, you feel much weaker...

Your watch gleefully as the Bull Centaurs herd in masses of slaves up the stairs of the ziggurat, towards the great, brazen statue of Hashut, a pool of molten metal beneath it acts as it's furnace. As the Bull Centaur places them close to the furnace, you hear multiple mumbles and whimpers coming from the wretches.\n\nThey're pushed one by one into the pool of molten metal, their anguished laments forming a wonderful choir...
Mighty Hashut! Accept the slave blood and slave flesh we offer thee!
Note that Chaos Dwarfs or Nehekharan Tomb Kings aren't a valid prisoner sacrifice!
The slave population in [Root.Capital.GetName]'s factories has recently declined due to chocking smoke, factory accidents, famine and general mismanagement
Hashut's cock! Well, we'll have to get more slaves...

Hashut's cock! Well, we'll have to get more slaves...
The Bullfather is pleased with your offering. As your sacrifice dissolves into the molten metal pit, you hear a booming voice coming from the brazen idol's head...offering you gifts
Grant me some of your fiery K'daai servants, to sear my enemies!
Mighty Hashut, bless me with your strength!
Great Hashut, touch my lands with your fire!
Bullfather, grant me greater dominion over the Winds!
The Bullfather must be pleased with you, for after your sacrifice dissolves into the molten pit, a daemonic creature of fire and steel surges from it, pledging itself to your service

I will soar on wings of fire!

As the sacrifice sinks into the molten pit you hear the booming voice of Hashut in your head, praising you... His greatest son!
After the sacrifice sinks into the molten metal pit, you receive visions of yourself... a crown of fire is on your brows, burning... burning, until naught but ash remains...
Why? What is the meaning of this?!
As the sacrifice sinks into the molten pit you get closer to it, in order to receive your gift... when suddenly a gush of molten metal sprays you in the face
At last the sacrifice dissolves into the molten pit of metal... and the ritual room is filled with a most dire silence. It seems that the Bullfather has ignored your offering!

Praise Mighty Hashut! After all the sacrifices and absolute servitude, the Bullfather has finally granted you His greatest of gifts: dominion over the Winds of Magic! Soon the whole world will be under your yoke, for now, you're one of the great, magnificent masters of the Dawi Zharr, a Sorcerer-Prophet!

The K'daai Zharr - Scions of Fire - are Hashut's servants. Forged from the raging blood and metal of the Bullfather's sacrifice pits, the K'daai are half-daemon and half-raging fire, an elemental force of destruction few mortals can hope to survive.
Though Hashut has fewer daemons aligned to him than the greater Chaos gods, they're still powerful entities, made to enslave and destroy all those who oppose him.
The K'daai slowly takes form before you, a creature of magma and iron, half-daemon and half-raging fire. The circle holds and the daemon is yours to command.
Your ritual for [From.GetFirstName] was a success. You've managed to bind a searing K'daai to [From.GetHerHim].

Dwarf rulers can declare reconquest wars to reclaim counties that are not held by Dwarfs or Norse Dwarfs, and are either inside de-jure Karaz Ankor and Drak Ankor or mountains held by Greenskins or Skaven.

Though the greater part of a Dwarf hold is mostly underground, there are plenty of defensive surface structures as well, all connected to the main hold through tunnels. These include gatehouses, lookout towers and trenches.

The heart of every Dwarf realm is the Hold, a well-protected fortress settlement, which is centered in a system of halls, chambers, and defensive barriers, usually located within the interior of a mountain.

The bulk of Dwarf forces is formed by warriors, and the quarrellers, armed with powerful crossbows. In times of war, the leaders of each clan call the muster, and any Dwarf old enough to fight form into regiments. Most of them are craftsmen, miners and stone-carvers, but when any of them dons their armour and weapons, warfare becomes their only calling.

The Guild Workshops are the manufacturing and mercantile centre of all Dwarf Holds, as they attract artisans and merchants from all over the world, Dwarf or otherwise. Often, these places draw in younger, less conservative Dwarfs of lesser clans, which sees the introduction and eventual acceptance of new technologies.

This is where the rulers of the Dwarf Hold reside, along with their personal guard, servants, and the most esteemed clan and guild members. They're filled with finely hewn stone and beautiful gems. They have many chambers, to inspire awe and admiration in visitors and vassals alike.

These halls contain finely engraved walls with the most interesting stories to tell anyone patient enough to study them all. Everything from the legendary battles of the War of Vengeance to the fierce battles during the goblin wars are depicted with such detail you'd swear it was alive.

These halls are filled with an enormous networks of chambers and filled with some of the most finest examples of Dwarf stonework. They show the splendour and magnificence of the Dwarf race and inspiring awe in all who view them.

You can expect to find a forge in every Dwarf Hold, no matter how small. The Dwarfs are the best metalworkers in the known world and parts of that excellence in metalworks can be seen even in the smallest of smithies.

A medium sized smithy producing mainly axes and hammers for the Dwarf warriors. If it weren't for the high quality weapons that the Dwarf smiths make so would there be no Dwarf realms left. The Dwarf smiths know that and they bear that responsibility with pride.

Few enemies have the courage to face the Dwarfs on the battlefield when they are in their famous shieldwall. Other than the extreme fierceness that the Dwarfs shows in battle so are the high quality armor an important part in not breaking the formation which is the only way to beat the Dwarfs on the battlefield. There is a reason why Dwarf shields rarely turn into splinter.
These huge complex smithies involves hundreds of metalworkers all devoted to the production of the weapons that the Dwarfs are so proud of.

Dwarf handgunners, known as Thunderers, they usually stand in close ranks and methodically fire round after round. Dwarf handguns are much more precise and less prone to misfires than their Human counterparts, and as such, the handgun is quickly becoming much more popular than the crossbow in Dwarf armies. Most Thunderers craft their own guns, each one trying to outdo the others on who has made the most precise of handguns.

The Dwarfs are masters of steamworks and metallurgy, and their fleets reflect this fact. Dwarf Ships are massive armored hulks, protected by layers of steel forged in the greatest of foundries. Each ships also transports many spare parts and a crew of Engineers in case repairs are needed in the high sea, as well as trade goods.
The minor holds and trading outposts of a Dwarf Guild are not as heavily fortified as a proper Karak, but their surface watchtowers and draw bridges still make for formidable defenses.

Many minor outposts and settlements all across Karak Ankor are claimed by various Dwarf Guilds. These Guild Holds are not as fortified as the mighty Karaks of the noble Clans, and are usually full of young, enterprising Dwarfs seeking to make a name for themselves.
Even if their calling is not the art of war, every Dwarf has a warrior’s spirit, and even the lowest miners and metalsmiths will take up arms to defend their Guild’s honor at any cost.

The Guild Holds have special areas in the higher deeps that receive goods from all over the Karaz Ankor. These depots are effectively inland ports, acting as offloading areas for trade caravans bringing in hops, goats, leather, and bolts of cloth, gems, ores as well as various other merchandise

If Dwarfs are the undisputed masters of smithing, then the Metalsmiths’ Guild are the greatest among them. Deep in the Guild Holds are foundries of these master smiths, containing great furnaces that burn hotter than the stars. The armour and weapons crafted here is amongst the finest – if not the finest - craftsmanship in the Old World.

Though the Dwarfs are known for their mastery in stoneworking and metalworking, they’re also excellent carpenters. Here the Carpenters’ Guild fashions weapons like crossbows or the mighty Grudge Throwers. They’re also known to perform as Quarrelers whenever the need to defend the Guild Hold arises.

Though all Dwarf Holds are home to a Hall of Deeds, a section of the hold devoted to remembering and recording the deeds of particularly successful Dwarfs, none are greater than the ones inside a Guild Hold. Each Guild wants to make sure that the deeds of their esteemed ancestors and guild-founders are properly recorded and guarded, and they will spare no expense on these endeavors.

The Cannons made by the Dwarfs are of the highest quality, much less prone to misfires and malfunctions that the Human ones. First made by the Dwarfs of Zhufbar, now, most Dwarf clans maintain a number of cannons They are hauled into overlooking positions on the battlefield, where their long range and potent shot can dictate the course of the enemy's actions. Given the quality of their make, many Cannons have been in service for a number of centuries and are revered by their crew..

The Runesmiths’ Guild has special reverence towards the Ancestor Gods, and usually lend their aid to the Shrine Holds in the form of mighty runic wards in order to protect the abodes of the Ancestors.

Many, if not all, Dwarf Karaks have a Hall of Sanctity dedicated to the Ancestor Gods. In many holds, there are mountain shrines separate from the main structure, devoted solely to the veneration of the Ancestors. These places are much smaller than a usual hold, normally consisting of a great hall housing statues or shrines to the Ancestor Gods surrounded by smaller halls. These shrine holds usually defer to the main Karaks for protection, though their are very capable of defending themselves.

The Ancestral Guard is composed by Dwarfs who have chosen to fully commit themselves to the protection of the Ancestor Gods’ shrines, temples and statues. Most of the Shrine Holds will have a hall housing a garrison of these stubborn defenders.

The Lorekeepers are Dwarfs charged with chronicling, recording and remembering Dwarf law and lore. They also fulfil a role somewhat akin to priests, maintaining the shrines and records of the Ancestor Gods. They usually reside in great library chambers, constantly buried and lost in great books. Many Dwarf Lords also trust them with accounting and other monetary duties, a task they begrudgingly accept.

These echoing chambers contain only the local Karak’s Book of Grudges, a hefty tome where all wrongs against the Hold are recorded, never to be forgotten. The local Grudge Keeper scribbles down the king’s pronouncements and spends the rest of the year carefully updating the Book of Grudges.

Grungni is one of the three chief Ancestor Gods.  He is the god of mining and smiths and he is both an artisan and a warrior god. His main credo is oath and honour, upon which Dwarf society is built, and as such, statues and shrines consecrated to him will boost the local Dwarfs’ stubbornness and morale.\n Each Shrine Hold can only hold a single shrine dedicated to one of the three chief Ancestor Gods.

Grimnir is one of the three chief Ancestor Gods.  He is the god of warriors and the patron of the Slayer Cult. Statues and shrines consecrated to him will boost the local Dwarfs’ bravery in battle and attract a small detachment of Slayers.\n Each Shrine Hold can only have a single shrine dedicated to one of the three chief Ancestor Gods.

Valaya is one of the three chief Ancestor Gods.  She is the goddess of healing and protection, and founder of many of the Dwarf Karaks. Statues and shrines consecrated to her will be defended by a cadre of Sisters of Valaya, female guards dedicated to the Ancestor Goddess and armed with the finest handguns.\n Each Shrine Hold can only have a single shrine dedicated to one of the three chief Ancestor Gods.

Khypris (formerly the Capital of the vast Khyprian Empire) is one of the original Kingdoms of the Borderlands, once reaching to the tip of the Black Mountains and comprising of the three provinces of the Northlands, the Heartland and the Westland's. While the age of the khyprote empire is long gone, the city still remains a wondrous site on the region, and heavily controls trade in the region.

The City-State of Argalis has had a long and chequered history, first built by the High Elves and named Tor Ancor around -3419. It then fell during the war of vengeance in -1974 when a Dwarf army marched on it following the death of Prince Snorri Halfhand (in a duel with Caledor the 2nd). Only a small colony, the Elves abandoned Tor Ancor to its fate and it was razed to the ground soon after by the vengeful Dwarves. The city lay in ruins until human tribesmen willingly built on the ruins of the former Elf colony in -1125 – seeking to make their mark as the dominant tribe in the region. Unfortunately this tribe attracted the attention of a Vampire – whose bloodline would later be traced to the Von Carstein's.

Akendorf has an electoral-monarchy system in which leaders are voted into power, Akendorf's nobles run an electoral monarchy system. They have economy centred on timber, woodcarvings, they hunt wild boars in the forests which is an eagerly sought after commodity for the furs and meat.

Arnalos straddles along the river Limnalia, having been founded as a High Elven colony many centuries ago, but abandon and then resettled by Humans, only to have the Vampire counts take control of the region for some time. The city has recovered to an extent, and exerts control over some of the many trade routes to and from the Vaults.
Aldium is a popular destination for Dogs-of-War and would-be mercenaries, but recent evidence suggests that it used to be an old Dwarf hold, why it was forgotten is unknown.

The closest human settlement to Karak Thorinkin and the only major one actually found within the mountain ranges themselves. The Thorinkin maintain a fortress (Khazad Thufill) near to Domatburg helping guard passes through the mountains and the trade road that links the town and the hold together. Relations between the two peoples are very strong with the Thorinkin actually constructing Domatburg's defences and providing support for the humans against Grobbi that infest the area. The relationship was strong enough that an area between Domatburg and Khazad Thufill was chosen by King Druegar Stromnisson as the site for the Holds new Brewery.

Fatandira is a member of the Northern Confederacy City-States – Fatanbad is their sister City State. Due to it's close proximity to Greenskins and the Stygian woods, the population and thus power of the city has declined recently.

Myrmidens was founded by settlers from Luccinni in Tilea and named in honour of the goddess Myrmidia, it is one of the largest realms of the Borderlands and a traditional naval enemy of Achaes, and keeps the Sartosian pirates and Greenskin raiders away from Tilea.

Karak Kadrin, otherwise known as Slayer Keep, is a mighty Dwarf hold that has guarded the one of the few major passes through World's Edge Mountains, the peak pass. For countless centuries this hold has guarded the lands of Kislev and the Empire to west against greenskin threats and worse. The hold is home to the Shrine of Grimnir and is a sacred place for all would-be Slayers. The hold also has a long history of Slayer Kings who have passed down their slayer oath through generations.

Everpeak, Karaz-a-Karak in the language of the Dwarfs, is the ancient capital of the Dwarf empire, the Pinnacle of Mountains, the Most Enduring. It is the oldest and most glorious holds of the mountain folk and inside its halls is the greatest concentration of wealth in the world. Visitors have been awestruck at the magnificent beauty of the place. The most important hold politically and religiously in Dwarf culture, Karaz-a-Karak boasts of the mightiest army, greatest runesmiths and largest population out of all the Dwarf realms. It is from here that the High Kings rule and where the sacred Great Book of Grudges and the Book of Remembering are kept. It has endured countless ages against all manner of foes but it has never fallen and will endure until the end of time.

Zhufbar, known as the Torrent-Gate in Khazalid, is a dwarf hold built nestled in a deep chasm under the lake called Black Water. A huge waterfall that falls high above the city provides the necessary power for the numerous Dwarf machines that have been constructed here. The city is the principle shrine for the Engineers Guild and is a center of every kind of industry. It was here that the famed Gromril metal, which was mined from nearby Karak Varn, was smelted and forged into many famous Dwarfen artefacts.

Barak Varr is a unique Dwarf hold in that it is the only Dwarf seaport in the world and houses the whole Dwarf fleet. Located at the easternmost point of the Black Gulf, the hold is built in a vast water filled cavern, carved into a cliffside which provides a natural defence for the harbour. The mighty Ironclad ships of the Dwarfs as well as numerous merchant vessels from all over the world can be found here as well, sailing in and out of the vast cavern. This hold is among the most friendly to non-Dwarfs and in turn has great revenue from trade.

column2: The following competitors made the final lists:\n
column3: Les compétiteurs suivants participeront aux lices finales :\n
[This.GetTitledFirstName] [This.GetOnlyDynastyName]

column2: After arriving in [From.Capital.GetName] the first day of the tourney began in earnest. You tilted against many lesser knights throughout the day, most of whom you unhorsed easily. Now in the coming days the final round of lists begins, and the opposition shall surely be more fierce.
column3: Après votre arrivée à [From.Capital.GetName] vous avez participé au premier jour du tournoi. Vous avez affronter de nombreux chevaliers de moindre talent que vous facilement démonté. Le dernier tour commence demain et les adversaires vont se sûrement être d'un tout autre niveau.
Je dois préparer mon cheval.

column2: The tourney herald anounces the competitiors of the next joust, you have been drawn against [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. You mount your charge, take a lance from your squire and ride to the end of the list as [From.GetTitledFirstName] does likewise. Then on queue the horses break into a gallop...
column3: Le héraut du tournoi annonce les compétiteurs pour la prochaine joute, vous avez été désigné pour affronter [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. Vous vous équipez, demandez une lance à votre écuyer puis vous chevauchez jusqu'au bout de la lice tandis que [From.GetTitledFirstName] fait de même. Puis les chevaux se lancent au galop l'un contre l'autre...
Maintenir…
La première joute commence…

column2: As you close in on your opponent you see an opening. You deftly guide your lance into strike whilst evading their charge...
column3: Alors que vous vous rapprochez de votre adversaire vous repérez une ouverture. Vous guidez adroitement votre lance pour frapper tout en évitant la charge de votre opposant…
Touché !

column2: Your opponent got the better of you when you met in the centre of the lists. Your lance merely makes a glancing blow on their armour, whilst their lance hits true...
column3: Votre adversaire a su repérer une ouverture au moment où vous vous êtes rencontrés au centre de la lice. Votre lance a à peine égratigner son armure tandis que la sienne a visé juste…
Oh…

column2: Your opponent is unfortunately no longer available to joust.
column3: Votre adversaire n'est malheureusement plus en état de jouter.
Bien, un autre maintenant !

column2: The blow from [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s lance sends you reeling, and you struggle to stay on your horse. The crowd gasps, expecting you to fall. However you maintain your grip, bringing your mount around the other side of lists ready for another charge.
column3: Le coup porté par la lance de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] vous a fait vacillé et vous luttez pour rester en selle. La foule retient son souffle, attendant que vous chutiez, mais vous parvenez à garder votre assise et replacez votre monture à l'autre bout de la lice, prêt pour une nouvelle charge.
Cette fois je vais frapper…
Une nouvelle joute commence…

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] took the full force of your lance and was sent reeling, and only managed a glancing blow upon your own armour. [From.GetSheHeCap] almost fell off, but managed to regain [From.GetHerHis] balance and round the other end of the lists ready for another tilt.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] a encaissé votre violent coup de lance et vacille, tandis qu'il n'est parvenu qu'à égratigner votre armure. [From.GetSheHeCap] a failli tomber de cheval, mais est parvenu à récupérer son assise avant de se diriger vers le bout de la lice, prêt pour une nouvelle joute.
Cette fois, je vais le heurter violemment.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s lance strikes you square in the middle of your breastplate, exploding into many pieces as it hits. The force knocks the wind out of you and sends you flying from your horse. You are left lying in the dirt defeated as the crowd cheers [From.GetTitledFirstName].
column3: La lance de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] vous a touché en plein milieu de votre pectoral avant de se briser en plusieurs morceaux. La violence du coup vous a propulsé loin de votre cheval. Vous gisez dans la boue tandis que la foule acclame [From.GetTitledFirstName].
Ouch

column2: You expertly struck [From.GetTitledFirstName] with your lance right in the middle of [From.GetHerHis] breastplate, causing your lance to shatter into a thousand pieces as [From.GetSheHe] is sent flying from the saddle. The crowd gives a great cheer at your victory, and is relieved to see [From.GetTitledFirstName] is unharmed.
column3: Vous avez frappé [From.GetTitledFirstName] avec précision, en plein milieu de son pectoral. Votre lance s'est brisée en mille morceaux et a propulsé votre adversaire à plusieurs mètres de là. La foule vous acclame et est soulagé de constater que [From.GetTitledFirstName] n'est pas blessé.

column2: A fine hit I must say
column3: Un joli coup je dois dire.

column2: You and [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] collide fiercely, both lances shattering in a hail of splinters. You both ride on still ahorse to the other end of the lists to take a new lance from a squire. You notice [From.GetTitledFirstName] is now bleeding profusely from a wound, but [From.GetSheHe] urges [From.GetHerHis] mount on for another charge regardless.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] et vous-même entrez violemment en collision, vos deux lances explosent en mille morceaux. Toujours à cheval, vous vous dirigez tout deux vers vos écuyers pour récupérer une nouvelle lance. Vous remarquez que [From.GetTitledFirstName] saigne désormais abondamment d'une blessure, mais [From.GetSheHe] ne semble pas s'en soucier et presse sa monture pour une nouvelle charge.

column2: This will give me an advantage
column3: Cela va me donner un avantage.

column2: As you and [From.GetTitledFirstName] meet you both score a good hit, both lances shattering as you both ride on still mounted. You are hit with a sudden bout of pain however as you realise you are now bleeding profusely. You take up a new lance from your squire anyway and charge gamely on.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] et vous même parvenez à délivrer une belle frappe, vos lances ont explosé mais vous êtes parvenu tout deux à rester en selle. Cependant vous ressentez tout à coup une douleur soudaine et réalisez que vous saignez abondamment. Sans vous en soucier outre mesure, vous demandez une nouvelle lance à votre écuyer et reprenez votre place pour une nouvelle charge.
Cela ne va pas m'arrêter.

column2: You are helpless as [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s lance forcefully knocks of your saddle and into the air. You land with a sickening crunch into the dirt, the pain is immense, you are sure something is broken...
column3: Vous vous sentez impuissant au moment où la lance de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] vous touche avec violence et vous jette à bas de votre selle. Vous vous écrasez par terre, la douleur est immense, vous êtes sûr que quelque chose s'est brisé...
Arrrggghhh!!!

column2: The hapless [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] has no chance as [From.GetSheHe] is sent flying by your ruthless strike of the lance. [From.GetSheHeCap] lands in the dirt with a sickening crunch at an awkward angle, and as a squire rushes to [From.GetHerHis] aid the crowd goes silent goes silent as they realise the seriousness of [From.GetHerHis] injuries.
column3: Le malchanceux [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] a été propulsé loin de sa monture par votre violent coup de lance. [From.GetSheHeCap] s'est écrasé par terre et vous avez nettement entendu un craquement. Un écuyer s'est précipité pour l'aider et la foule garde le silence, réalisant la gravité de ses blessures.
Alors, j'ai gagné non ?

column2: You know this is not right, you cannot land a blow on [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], whilst the point of [From.GetHerHis] lance is aimed true on you. As it strikes, the last thing you feel is the lance slipping between a gap in your armour, impaling you...
column3: Vous savez que ce n'est pas bon. Vous n'arrivez pas à maintenir votre lance dans la direction de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], tandis que la pointe de la sienne fonce droit sur vous. La dernière chose que vous ressentez est une intense douleur au moment du choc. La lance a touché une des articulations de votre armure et pénètre votre chair...
Arrrggghhh!!!

column2: At first you were pleased to land a hit, however the poin of your lance found a gap in [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s armour, impaling [From.GetHerHim] in a gruesome fashion. As people rush to [From.GetHerHis] aid, it becomes obvious there is nothing that can be done for [From.GetHerHim] as [From.GetHerHis] lifeblood spills onto the dirt.
column3: Au départ vous étiez heureux d'avoir touché, puis vous vous êtes rendu compte que la pointe de votre lance avait rencontré un point faible de l'armure de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] qui a fini empalé. Alors que tout le monde se précipite pour l'aider, il est devenu clair que rien ne pourra le sauver.
Quel malheur !

column2: You have been declared the winner, defeating [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] in a fine joust.
column3: Vous avez été déclaré vainqueur, battant [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] lors d'une bonne joute.
Personne ne peut me battre.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] has been declared the winner, defeating you and eliminating you from the tourney.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] a été déclaré vainqueur, vous ayant défait et éliminé du tournoi.
La prochaine fois !

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] were the next to joust in the lists. After many tilts and broken lances [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was eventually unhorsed, leaving [From.GetTitledFirstName] to be declared the winner.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] et [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] étaient les prochains à se rencontrer dans les lices. Après avoir brisé de nombreuses lances, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] a fini par être démonté et [From.GetTitledFirstName] a été déclaré vainqueur.
Une belle joute !

column2: After many tilts over several days only two knights remained undefeated. [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] faced eachother in the final joust, and after many tilts of finely executed jousting [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was unhorsed, leaving [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] to be declared the winner of the tourney.
column3: Après de très nombreuses joutes, seuls deux chevaliers sont restés invaincus. [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] et [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] se sont rencontrés lors de la dernière joute et après de nombreuses et belles charges [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] a été démonté et [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] a été déclaré vainqueur du tournoi.
Un digne champion.

column2: The Tourney comes to an end
column3: La tournoi prend fin.
Je vais aller voir toutes les joutes !

column2: Maybe some coin can persuade [From.GetHerHim] to fall?
column3: Peut-être que quelques pièces pourraient le(a) persuader de tomber ?

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] will be offered a bribe to lose the joust
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] va se voir proposer de l'argent pour perdre la joute.

column2: You have been drawn against [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] in the next joust, and [From.GetSheHe] is desperate to win it seems. [From.GetSheHeCap] has offered you a fine purse of coin to throw the tilt and let [From.GetHerHim] win.
column3: Vous avez été désigné pour affronter [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] lors de la prochaine joute et [From.GetSheHe] semble avoir peu d'espoir de gagner. [From.GetSheHeCap] vous a offert une belle bourse pour perdre la joute et le laisser gagner.

column2: A fair deal, I shall fall at the first tilt
column3: Une belle affaire, je vais tomebr lors de la première charge.
Quelle ignoble pratique !

column2: You purposely lose the joust against [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column3: Vous perdez délibérement la joute contre [From.GetTitledFirstName]
La joute se déroule normalement.

column2: When [From.GetSheHe] heard of your bribe, [From.GetTitledFirstName] feigned disgust and reluctance at first, but this was clearly a face saving act. [From.GetSheHeCap] eventually accepted your coin, and will now throw the joust at the first tilt.
column3: Lorsqu'[From.GetSheHe] a entendu parlé de votre offre, [From.GetTitledFirstName] a d'abord feint d'être dégouté et de vouloir refusé, mais il s'agissait clairement d'un jeu pour sauver la face. [From.GetSheHeCap] a fini par accepter votre argent et va perdre la joute lors de la première charge.
Tout le monde gagne.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] was outraged at your attempted bribe, [From.GetSheHe] called it a slight on [From.GetHerHis] honour and rejected it out of hand. [From.GetSheHeCap] vows to beat you on lists fairly.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] a été choqué par votre tentative de corruption, [From.GetSheHe] a refusé d'entacher son honneur et à rejeter votre offre. [From.GetSheHeCap] veut désormais vous battre sur la lice.
[From.GetSheHeCap] fait bien trop de cas de son honneur.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s aim is poor, but you casually shift your body in the way so you catch a mild blow from it. You throw yourself from the horse, adding some theatrics to make it look convincing, and in doing so losing the joust.
column3: Le coup porté par [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] est très faible et mal ajusté mais vous parvenez à vous positionner de façon à le recevoir sur votre pectoral. Vous sautez de cheval tout en ajoutant un peu de comédie pour que le coup paraisse convaincant. Vous avez perdu la joute.
Une bourse bien gagnée.

column2: You casually aim your lance in [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s general direction, sure of a strike in any case. [From.GetTitledFirstName] duly gets in the way and takes a mild blow, theatrically falling from [From.GetHerHis] horse to make a convincing show of it.
column3: Vous tendez votre lance comme vous le pouvez en direction de [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], sûr que vous allez le toucher. [From.GetTitledFirstName] parvient à se positionner de façon à prendre le coup puis chute en ajoutant assez de comédié pour que l'affaire pariasse convaincante.
Une victoire est une victoire.

column2: Whilst perparing for the tourney a young peasant boy has taken to helping with your horse and armour. You're not quite sure where he came from and how he came to start helping you, but he seems an earnest lad and eager to help. Perhaps he would make a good squire?
column3: Alors que vous vous prépariez pour le tournoi, un jeune paysan vous a proposé de vous aider avec votre armure et votre monture. Vous ne savez pas trop d'où il vient et pourquoi il veut vous aider. Peut-être qu'il pourrait faire un bon écuyer ?
Oui, je vais le prendre.

column2: I won't have some common urchin helping me, be gone!
column3: Je ne vais pas prendre un gamin du commun comme écuyer, déguerpis !

column2: I've been helping [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] in the tourney as [Root.Guardian.GetHerHis] squire, and at the end of the days jousting me and some other squires found a lot of wine! We shared it with some serving girls and had a great time, but the next morning has come and now I feel terrible.
column3: J'ai aidé [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] au tournoi en qualité d'écuyer. Hier soir, après les joutes, j'ai trouvé, avec d'autres écuyers, plusieurs bouteilles de vin ! Nous l'avons partagé avec quelques servantes et nous avons passé du bon temps. Mais ce matin je me sens très mal.
J'espère que [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] ne sera pas en colère.
[Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] réagit à votre gueule de bois.

column2: The days jousting is about to begin, and you realise your squire [From.GetTitledFirstName] is horribly hungover. You learn that [From.GetSheHe] and some other squires found a cask of wine and shared it with some serving girls, and got very drunk. His support as a squire in the lists will surely suffer.
column3: La journée de joute est sur le point de commencer et vous réalisez que votre écuyer [From.GetTitledFirstName] a une terrible gueule de bois. Vous apprenez qu'[From.GetSheHe] a découvert, avec d'autres ecuyers, quelques bouteilles de vin qu'ils ont partagé avec de jeunes servantes. [From.GetSheHeCap] risque d'avoir du mal à vous aider dans les lices.

column2: Ha! The young lad is growing up!
column3: Ha ! Ce petit jeune est entrain de grandir !

column2: I shall lecture him about his duty as a squire
column3: Je vais le sermonner sur ses devoirs en tant qu'ecuyer.

column2: Right, he has earned a good beating!
column3: Bien, il a mérité une vonne taloche !

column2: Whilst preparing for the tourney you and your squire have been training hard. You have been instructing him in the art of wielding a lance and riding a horse. There have also been intense sparring sessions, and he has been made to understand what his duties in the lists are.
column3: Lors de la préparation pour le tournoi, vous et votre écuyer vous êtes durement entrainés. Vous lui avez appris à manier la lance et à monter un cheval. Vous l'avez aussi entrainé au combat et il semble avoir compris ce qu'il doit faire dans les lices.

column2: He seems ready to assist me in the lists
column3: Il semble prêt à m'aider dans les lices.

column2: Whilst preparing for the tourney, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has found time to fit in training for you. [From.GetSheHeCap] has been instructing you in the proper use of a lance, and has been given you intense sparring sessions. Your duties as a squire in the lists have also been made absolutely clear.
column3: Lors de la préparation pour le tournoi, [From.GetTitledFirstName] a trouvé du temps pour vous entrainer. [From.GetSheHeCap] vous a instruit dans l'art du combat et de la lance. Vos devoirs dans les lices en tant qu'écuyer sont désormais tout à fait clairs.
Je suis un bon écuyer !

This character is currently on a knightly quest, scouring the land for evil to ride down with lance and sword.

This man has earned his reputation as a dreaded pirate and corsair.

You can finance [Root.GetFirstName], one of blaggards in your court and grant [Root.GetHerHim] command of a fleet to plunder in your name. While not vassalized, [Root.GetSheHe] will plunder nearby lands and send the booty back to you, this is, assuming [Root.GetSheHe] likes you well enough...

The plundering and looting undertaken by your fleets has earned you a reputation as a fearsome pirate. All along the seas of the world, mothers tucking their children in for the night warn that unless they behave, the terrible Captain [Root.GetFirstName], scourge of the seven seas, will come ashore with [Root.GetHerHis] dire seadogs and take them away.
column3: Les pillages commis en votre nom vous ont valu une réputation de redoutable razzieur fer-né. Tout le long des côtes de Westeros, les mères bordent leurs enfants le soir en leur disant que s'ils ne sont pas sages, le terrible [Root.GetFirstName], le fléau des mers, débarquera avec ses guerriers morts-vivants pour les manger.
column4: Das Brandschatzen und Plündern in Eurem Namen hat Euch den Ruf eines furchtlosen Wikinger-Räubers eingebracht. True to the customs of our ancestors, we parade our many gods, the Marid, once in a year so that all may bathe in their glory.
You have begun preparations for the Parade of the Idols. You send out messengers with invitations to your vassals, expecting all to come and honor [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Come all, to celebrate our gods!

Dear vassal,
I hereby invite you to attend the Parade of the Idols at [From.Capital.GetName].

Your Liege,
[From.GetTitledName]
Your vassal, [From.GetTitledName], has refused your invitation to the Parade of the Idols.

Guests have arrived from villages throughout the realm, to celebrate the Parade of the Idols. Already, idols to minor and foreign gods are starting to be paraded around the streets of [Root.Capital.GetName].
The Parade of the Idols is over for this time. The Thousand Idols have been properly honoured and the realm is looking forward to a bright future under their glory.

The Parade of the Idols is about to start, and in accordance with tradition, priests and pious men carry the idols and statues of our many gods in circles around the city, distributing blessings in the name of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and many others. To be allowed to carry one of the idols is a honor reserved for only those of great prestige and piety, as well as an event requiring strength and willpower.
Today I shall proudly carry the glory of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
I always enjoy watching the Parade. From a well shaded location.

As you carry the heavy idol around, you discover that it is rather more heavier that you expected. The unaccustomed weight causes you to stumble, and the statue slips out of your hands and crashes down on top of you.
Surely that's not a bad omen
As you carry the heavy idol around, the weight and the heat begin to take their toll on you. As if in a dream, you begin to hear the voices of the Marid talking, telling you secrets and mysteries.
The wisdom the Thousand is revealed to me!
With each step of the Parade, more and more of the truth of your gods is revealed. Of course this is the proper path, the path of our ancestors, how could any [Root.GetManWoman] doubt such a truth?
What once seemed so heavy at the start now feels as light as feather. Why, you could carry this idol around all day if the priests would let you!

After the Idols have been paraded around the city, the populace comes forward to present their sacrifices and venerations. You visit each idol in turn, praying for the straight of the Marid, venerating them with sacred offerings.
Collection of Offerings from the Pious

The final stage of the Parade is the collection of offerings and taxes from the pious. Every pious man is expected to give, for the greater glory of the Marid. While most give only a few coins, truly pious are expected to provide much more.\n\n As the priests wind their way towards you through the crowd, you reach for your purse. How much in offerings should you give today?
As much as I can spare, for the people need it more.
The bare minimum I can get away with.
Offerings? Bah, those soothsayers need to get a job!

The final ceremony is a grand sermon to thank our gods for their presence. It is was a rousing sermon as always, and the crowd begins the feast with great abandon. Another glorious celebration to the Marid has completed!
The worshippers of Kukaili ritualistically devour their prisoners to honour It. Eating [Root.GetFirstName] could be a good way to show praise to the Great Devourer.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] is brought before you, at an altar to Kukaili. You start the ritual by devouring [From.GetHerHis] heart, as this will please Kukaili mostly. [From.GetSheHe] watches in horror on his last breath… afterwards, you devour what's the rest of [From.GetHerHim] as well.

[From.GetTitledFirstName]'s tribesmen have you brought before [From.GetHerHim] and tied to an altar to their bloody god. You watch in horror as [From.GetSheHe] tears your heart out of your chest and eats it! Afterwards, all you see is darkness…

Dire news! It seems that the expedition you sent to Mist-covered waters in the northwestern Great Ocean has perished... the ships are intact, but all of the men inside them have disappeared. It is as if the Mists themselves are protecting something, as most who sail there never return...\n(Sending embarked troops through the Mists of Albion will cause all of them to die instantly)
I'll be more careful next time

Vuestro señor,
[From.GetFullName]

column3: Je n'ai pas le temps.

column2: In Druchii feasts, tradition dictates that you offer a slave, as a gift to your spouse. You should plan for this and buy something before the feast begins.

column4: Die Tradition verlangt, dass Ihr zum Herbstfest Eurem Ehepartner ein Geschenk macht. Ihr solltet dies planen und etwas kaufen, bevor das Fest beginnt.
column6: En el banquete Indio de otoño, es tradición que ofrezcas un regalo a tu esposa. Deberías planificarte y comprar algo antes de que comience el banquete.
